title: Chicken or Rooster Dingbats...Anyone?
content:
I'm looking for some dingbats that would contain silhouettes of a chicken and/or a rooster. I've done some digging today, but no luck. Can anyone point me to a font that would match this description?   
   
Thanks,   
Dylan
author: dylan

comments.content: This may be too whimsical, but you could try T26's [Chicken](http://web.archive.org/web/20130622103413/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=700).

Thanks for the tip. I kept digging -- found a royalty free line drawing and traced it in Freehand.   
   
Bawk! Bawk!   
   
Again, thanks for the quick response, Meredith.
I wrote a great chicken and egg joke. Just let me know if you want to hear it?

You might also want to check the [DF (Design Fonts)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130622103413/http:/www.letraset.com/us/template1.asp?catid=41&viewtype=all) series from Letraset, as well as dingbat fonts from FontHaus and Elsner+Flake (the latter has a couple fonts that are all birds).   
   
Also Scriptorium's [Sillhouette](http://web.archive.org/web/20130622103413/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/silhouette/) and [Funny Nature](http://web.archive.org/web/20130622103413/http:/www.urwpp.de/english/schrift/wahl5-set.htm) from URW++.
Oops, too late. Glad you found what you needed.

Gerald: Don't tease, man! Tell the joke!   
   
Meredith: Good thinking. Thanks again. I forgot about the DF stuff.   
   
Cheers, all.

**Question:** What came first, the chicken or the egg?   
**Answer:** I have it on good authority it was the rooster!

I know this is late, but I believe Golden Cockeral has a few nice chicken dingbats/silhouettes in it.   
   
My favorite chicken anecdote is based on a song by Paul Simon of Simon and Garfunkel called "Mother and Child Reunion"   
   
Apparently there is a menu item on most Chinese restaurants of the same name and is basically a chicken breast served with eggs. Kinda morbid but consider yourself enlightened :D   
   
Stuart :D

\> **Haha. Oops, that's just Paul Simon. He had left Garfy.**   
   
   
... good thing, too! ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130622103413im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
Haha. Oops, that's just Paul Simon. He had left Garfy.
